intro: Asperula cynanchica var. ansotana, commonly known as the Ansotan bluebell, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in partial shade to full sun. It has slender, branched stems and small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native habitat.
